instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> puls 0v-5v
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> puls 0v-5v 
dont see any shot on board.
i know its crap board and CPU but want to make sure that is really dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> puls 0v-5v
threads.message:
If you get puls at USB port, board may try to start.
You should check for short on power rails.
Any voltage at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> puls 0v-5v
threads.message: no voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery and with charger.. i will try to find short

threads.message: If CPU is shorted to ground, the board is trash...
